name: The talking book

quests.name: Wait what?
quests.description: I have no idea what this one does. Or where it comes from. We need to find out more.

tasks.longDescription: It appears to be some kind of new technology? Or ancient? I can't tell where it comes from but I have never seen such craftsmanship ever before.
It is some kind of storage device. Maybe a long forgotten technology. We should be very very careful with it.

That will definitely change the way of exploration. Maybe we are not the first ones who travel these lands? You can store a 10x10x10 area in them, rename them, change their size, WHAT CAN'T YOU DO? Shift rightclick a filled dynocap.

quests.name: Now you see me ...
quests.description: Everything we have found so far leads to the conclusion that an ancient civilization left all these technological miracles. First the capsules, now teleporters?

tasks.longDescription: The portals are a little tricky, build the base, store coordinates in shards, put the shard into the base, teleport to the saved coordinates via shift click while standing on the base.
Little trick - always keep 1-2 shards with important coordinates in your backpack!

quests.name: ... the next station.
quests.description: You really showed them who's the boss. Think we are done here? This is only the beginning! I've been able to decrypt some of my older pages and I have found something very interesting.

tasks.longDescription: This one is essential if you ever plan on crafting your own Age of Exile gear. It is the tool to generate different tiers of crafting dust and sometimes it genererates some leftovers like iron nuggets or ingots. For the station to work you simply put gear you don't need anymore into it and wait a few seconds until it's done. (Small tip: try to combine a Salvage Station with hoppers and chests!)

Insert any item with empty sockets in the left field, insert a gem or rune in the right field, then click on the hammer. Used to upgrade your gear with all kinds of useful things. -> visit the wiki for more information.

If you want to prevent your items from beeing destroyed you should treat them good. Repair them every now and then! Put the item you want to repair into the bottom slot and use fuel in the top one. There are different fuels you can use - each comes with different fuel efficience. Examples are redstone dust, iron ingots or magic essence. To see all usable fuels hover the help icon in the top right corner of the station interface.

quests.name: The grind is real
quests.description: You can take enchantments off items with the grindstone. That way you can reuse them! There is also no limit for enchantments if you use the anvil.

quests.name: No base? No problem.
quests.description: It's like the repair station but you can use it on the go. Fuels can't be used to their fullest. The kit itself can be filled with fuel - this item is not one time use!

quests.name: Experience Storage
quests.description: It is like I would expect you to die.

quests.name: Backpacker
quests.description: I know where this is going. You are going to throw me in there. I knew it.

quests.name: Fortify!
quests.description: A good base needs traps. This philosophy has proven itself multiple times.

quests.name: I don't like fire that much
quests.description: What would the adventurer be without the campfire. Good old technique. But did you know you can use them as respawn point?

tasks.longDescription: It is simple. When I apply preasure here, here and there - and at the same influence the transdimensional strings that hold together the universe I can change this stone into coal! Don't want to brag.

quests.name: Backpacker
quests.description: This might take a bit longer but it is going to be worth it. If you want to increase your storage capacity you should try to finish this one fast! Place it on your backslot and access it with "b".

tasks.longDescription: Bloodmagic is something I normally don't want to do but right now we don't have any alternatives. You will need a strong stomache for this one.
did you really think I would need crafting tables?

quests.name: Dude where is my horse?
quests.description: Don't get used to it. Might get eaten alive, incenerated, thrown off a cliff ...

tasks.longDescription: It is highly recommended that you do not under any circumstances name your horse. Forming a bond with it will only increase the pain of losing it.
The basics of alchemy one would think. I am a bit rusty the first tries could lead to unexpected results.
This is not a nametag for the living thing. This is a nametag for it's gravestone. The average horse life duration is ~ 10 minutes.

quests.name: Research Task II
quests.description: You are ready now to tackle the first big obstacle. I will summon a Golem projection and you will kill it. Easy as that.

tasks.longDescription: In order to summon the golem make sure to check the Age of Exile Book, crafted with one bone and one book.

quests.name: Research Task I
quests.description: Wait you think this is just about you? I need to gather information about the creatures that inhabit this hostile environment. We will start with something relatively harmless. Except for the Charged Creeper - this one still does damage.

tasks.longDescription: I want to try and summon one of these creeper things but they are acting strange. Did you see the small ones?
Since they aren't fighting back they should be a worthy opponent for you. Kill a few and try to find out more about them!
It seems like they grow just like plants do. You can bonemeal them and they grow with sunlight. Some of them even leave spores I wonder what they do?

quests.name: Alchemists best friend!
quests.description: This bag stores potions, you can open it with shiftclick, use it with rightclick and rotate the potions with "k".

quests.name: Camo
quests.description: I am proud to say that at least this time around I came up with it myself. I used this tech a lot back when I ... wasn't a book.

quests.name: Furnace. Super Furnace.
quests.description: No need for stacking them anymore or complex furnace systems. Place one, upgrade it, be happy. They might cause some anomalies - if my calculations are correct it is possible that some items get duplicated?

quests.name: First steps
quests.description: Hey. Hey you. What? Never seen a talking book before? Why do I always get these ... freshlings. Well we have no time to waste this realm gets uhm a little uncomfortable at night. Here, build the basic stuff. I will give you further instructions once you are done. And if you are still alive by then.

tasks.description: You built this on your own?

quests.name: So much utility!
quests.description: Not much to say about this one. Now you can craft while you hide or run away! The perfect addition to a "hero" like you.

tasks.longDescription: Rightclick with the crafting pad in your hand to open a portable crafting station.

quests.name: The miracle of life
quests.description: This might be a little too much for your human brain. But I can help you do things a little more ... efficient.

tasks.description: Get me some sand. Don't ask.
tasks.longDescription: To see a world in a grain of sand and heaven in a wild flower Hold infinity in the palm of your hand and eternity in an hour. William Blake said that. Smart guy.

tasks.description: It's always dirt I know I know
tasks.longDescription: Dirt is interesting. It is such a basic material but you can build whole worlds with it. Don't you think the same? Stop digging and listen to me!
Some glass, some iron and boom we got it. Instant magic! The perfect vessel if you need a quick wood fix.

quests.name: Modification Process
quests.description: Along your journey you will find different items - currency items to be precicse - which can be used to modify and oftentimes improve your gear. To use these currency items you need a Gear Modify Station. The crafting recipe looks a little different - you need a Heart of Imagination in order to craft the station which can only be obtained by summoning and defeating the Golem boss. To use this station put the gear you want to modify in the bottom slot and the item you want to use on it in the top slot. Now press the hammer and you are done!

quests.name: I can teach you the moves
quests.description: Everything okay? No arm missing so far? All your blood still in your body? Good. I have some tips for you: (all keybindings can be changed in options)

tasks.longDescription: If you press left shift while you touch a wall midair, then release it - you will perform a walljump. Get used to this!
Crawling is useful to dodge stuff, to escape from zombies quickly or to hide if you are too afraid to face your enemies. (If that is the case please give this book to the next STRONG warrior.)

Well you do apparently. Here you go. Press "m" to open your worldmap. Press "u" to open your waypoint menu. You will never get lost ever again! I hope. Also, you can scroll down on the left page to see more quest-steps.

Open your Stats&Skills menu with "h". You get experience and levels by slaying hostile monsters. Spend your Statpoints and Talentpoints to get stronger! Check the Age of Exile wiki if you need further information.
If you ever lose either me (the questbook! How DARE you?) or the Age of Exile Guidebook - you can craft them both. Check the recipes with REI!

description: This chapter teaches you the very basics about this modpack. Please make sure to also read the Questtext since some mechanics can only be explained that way. I wish you the very best and I hope you enjoy this little journey!
